oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable IPv6 Kernel Module Functionality via Disable Option
oval:metadata.oval:description: The disable option will allow the IPv6 module to be inserted, but prevent address assignment and activation of the network stack.

oval:criterion.comment: ipv6 disabled any modprobe conf file

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: Verify that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg is group owned by gid 0.

oval:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify the UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: Verify that UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg is owned by uid 0.

oval:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is not UEFI

oval:metadata.oval:title: Force IOMMU usage in GRUB2
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for argument iommu=force in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

oval:criterion.comment: check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: File permissions for /boot/grub2/grub.cfg should be set to 0600 (or stronger).

oval:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify the UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: Verify that UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg is group owned by 0.

oval:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is not UEFI

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: Verify that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg is owned by uid 0.

oval:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable core dump backtraces
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'ProcessSizeMax' with value '(?i)0(?-i)' in section 'Coredump' in '/etc/systemd/coredump.conf'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable storing core dump
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'Storage' with value '(?i)none(?-i)' in section 'Coredump' in '/etc/systemd/coredump.conf'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify that System.map files are readable only by root
oval:metadata.oval:description: Checks that /boot/System.map-* are only readable by root.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
oval:metadata.oval:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
oval:metadata.oval:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

oval:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp is configured to bind mount to /tmp
Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure apt_get gpgcheck Globally Activated
oval:metadata.oval:description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Package Antivirus Installed
oval:metadata.oval:description: Antivirus software should be installed.

oval:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

oval:metadata.oval:title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
oval:metadata.oval:description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

oval:metadata.oval:title: Package McAfeeVSEForLinux Installed
oval:metadata.oval:description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

oval:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

oval:metadata.oval:title: McAfee AntiVirus Definitions Updated
oval:metadata.oval:description: Verify that McAfee AntiVirus definitions have been updated.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if McAfee AntiVirus definitions have been updated

oval:metadata.oval:title: Install the Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module
oval:metadata.oval:description: Install the McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module if it is absolutely necessary. If SELinux is enabled, do not install or enable this module.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
oval:metadata.oval:description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

oval:metadata.oval:title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
oval:metadata.oval:description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Harden SSHD Crypto Policy
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'CRYPTO_POLICY' with value ''-oCiphers=aes128-ctr,aes256-ctr,aes128-cbc,aes256-cbc -oMACs=hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha2-512 -oGSSAPIKeyExchange=no -oKexAlgorithms=diffie-hellman-group14-sha1,ecdh-sha2-nistp256,ecdh-sha2-nistp384,ecdh-sha2-nistp521 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=ssh-rsa,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384 -oPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes=ssh-rsa,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384'' in '/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensshserver.config'

oval:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure NOPASSWD Is Not Used in Sudo
oval:metadata.oval:description: Checks sudo usage without password

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure Users Re-Authenticate for Privilege Escalation - sudo
oval:metadata.oval:description: Checks sudo usage without password

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure !authenticate Is Not Used in Sudo
oval:metadata.oval:description: Checks sudo usage without authentication

oval:metadata.oval:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
oval:metadata.oval:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

oval:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix with either sufficient or default=ignore
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth

oval:metadata.oval:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
oval:metadata.oval:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

oval:criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
oval:metadata.oval:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

oval:metadata.oval:title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
oval:metadata.oval:description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
oval:metadata.oval:description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

oval:criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

oval:metadata.oval:title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
oval:metadata.oval:description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

oval:criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

oval:metadata.oval:title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
oval:metadata.oval:description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

oval:criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

oval:metadata.oval:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
oval:metadata.oval:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
oval:metadata.oval:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
oval:metadata.oval:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
oval:metadata.oval:description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
oval:metadata.oval:description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
oval:metadata.oval:description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

oval:criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
oval:metadata.oval:description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

oval:criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

oval:metadata.oval:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
oval:metadata.oval:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure that FAIL_DELAY is Configured in /etc/login.defs
oval:metadata.oval:description: The delay between failed authentication attempts should be set for all users specified in /etc/login.defs

oval:metadata.oval:title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
oval:metadata.oval:description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

oval:criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

oval:criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

oval:metadata.oval:title: Configure auditd space_left on Low Disk Space
oval:metadata.oval:description: space_left setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
oval:metadata.oval:description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

oval:metadata.oval:title: Kerberos 5 Authentication and Encryption in Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
oval:metadata.oval:description: enable_krb5 setting in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf is set to 'yes'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Is Full
oval:metadata.oval:description: disk_full_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Errors
oval:metadata.oval:description: disk_error_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
oval:metadata.oval:description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

oval:metadata.oval:title: Configure audispd Plugin Remote Server IP address or Hostname
oval:metadata.oval:description: remote_server setting in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf is set to a certain IP address or hostname

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
oval:metadata.oval:description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
oval:metadata.oval:description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

oval:metadata.oval:title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
oval:metadata.oval:description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
oval:metadata.oval:description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

oval:metadata.oval:title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
oval:metadata.oval:description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
oval:metadata.oval:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

oval:criteria.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

oval:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

oval:metadata.oval:title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
oval:metadata.oval:description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

oval:metadata.oval:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
oval:metadata.oval:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root group

oval:metadata.oval:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
oval:metadata.oval:description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

oval:extend_definition.comment: rsyslog daemon is used as local logging daemon

oval:criterion.comment: Check permissions of all system log files

oval:metadata.oval:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
oval:metadata.oval:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root user

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure the logrotate utility performs the automatic rotation of log files on daily basis
oval:metadata.oval:description: The frequency of automatic log files rotation performed by the logrotate utility should be configured to run daily

oval:criteria.comment: /etc/logrotate.conf contains daily setting and /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists

oval:criterion.comment: Check if daily is set in /etc/logrotate.conf
Check if /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists (and calls logrotate)

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

oval:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
oval:metadata.oval:description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

oval:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:criteria.comment: SSH version is equal or higher than 7.4 has deprecated RhostsRSAAuthentication

oval:extend_definition.comment: OpenSSH version 7.4 or higher has deprecated RhostsRSAAuthentication

oval:metadata.oval:title: Rule title of sshd_use_priv_separation
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'UsePrivilegeSeparation' with value 'sandbox' in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

oval:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
oval:metadata.oval:description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

oval:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set OpenSSH authentication attempt limit (MaxAuthTries)
oval:metadata.oval:description: The SSH MaxAuthTries should be set to an appropriate value.

oval:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
oval:metadata.oval:description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

oval:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable Compression Or Set Compression to delayed
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'Compression' with value '(no|delayed)' in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

oval:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:criterion.comment: Check the absence of Compression in /etc/ssh/sshd_config

oval:metadata.oval:title: Check that no unauthenticated repository is authorized by configuration
oval:metadata.oval:description: Accessing a repository should be allowed only when the repository is authenticated.

oval:criteria.comment: Detect any usage of allow-ynauthenticated option

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set number of records to cause an explicit flush to audit logs
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'freq' with value '(?i)50(?-i)' in '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Include Local Events in Audit Logs
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'local_events' with value '(?i)yes(?-i)' in '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'

oval:criterion.comment: Check the absence of local_events in /etc/audit/auditd.conf

oval:metadata.oval:title: Resolve information before writing to audit logs
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'log_format' with value '(?i)ENRICHED(?-i)' in '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Set hostname as computer node name in audit logs
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'name_format' with value '(?i)hostname(?-i)' in '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'

oval:metadata.oval:title: Write Audit Logs to the Disk
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'write_logs' with value '(?i)yes(?-i)' in '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'

oval:criterion.comment: Check the absence of write_logs in /etc/audit/auditd.conf

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable Host-Based Authentication
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for parameter 'HostbasedAuthentication' with value 'no' in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

oval:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

oval:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

oval:criterion.comment: Check the absence of HostbasedAuthentication in /etc/ssh/sshd_config

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/group Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group is group owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/gshadow Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is group owned by 42.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/passwd Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd is group owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/shadow Group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is group owned by 42.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/group Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group is owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/gshadow Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/passwd Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd is owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/shadow Owner
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is owned by 0.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/group Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/gshadow Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/passwd Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/shadow Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/ssh/ Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/ssh/ has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Verify /etc/ssh/ Mode Permissions
oval:metadata.oval:description: This test makes sure that /etc/ssh/ has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable rds Kernel Module
oval:metadata.oval:description: The kernel module rds should be disabled.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Disable tipc Kernel Module
oval:metadata.oval:description: The kernel module tipc should be disabled.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Add nodev Option to /dev/shm
oval:metadata.oval:description: /dev/shm should be mounted with mount option nodev.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Add nosuid Option to /dev/shm
oval:metadata.oval:description: /dev/shm should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /srv Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /srv. If /srv will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /tmp Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /tmp. If /tmp will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var. If /var will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /var/log Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var/log. If /var/log will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /var/log/audit Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var/log/audit. If /var/log/audit will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service auditd Enabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The auditd service should be enabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package auditd installed and service auditd is configured to start
service auditd is configured to start and is running
service auditd is configured to start

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service chronyd Enabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The chronyd service should be enabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package chrony installed and service chronyd is configured to start
service chronyd is configured to start and is running
service chronyd is configured to start

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service cron Enabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The cron service should be enabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package cron installed and service cron is configured to start
service cron is configured to start and is running
service cron is configured to start

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service ip6tables Enabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The ip6tables service should be enabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package iptables-ipv6 installed and service ip6tables is configured to start
service ip6tables is configured to start and is running
service ip6tables is configured to start

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service iptables Enabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The iptables service should be enabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package iptables installed and service iptables is configured to start
service iptables is configured to start and is running
service iptables is configured to start

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service netfs Disabled
oval:metadata.oval:description: The netfs service should be disabled if possible.

oval:criteria.comment: package netfs removed or service netfs is not configured to start
service netfs is not configured to start

oval:criterion.comment: Property LoadState of service netfs is masked
Property FragmentPath of service netfs is set to /dev/null

oval:metadata.oval:title: Service ntp Enabled

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: ipv6 disabled any modprobe conf file
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
tests the value of ProcessSizeMax setting in the /etc/systemd/coredump.conf file
tests the value of Storage setting in the /etc/systemd/coredump.conf file

ns4:file_test.comment: system.map files readable only by root

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure /var/tmp is configured to bind mount to /tmp
Ensure bind mount option is on /var/tmp

ns5:partition_test.comment: Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns3:variable_test.comment: McAfee AntiVirus definitions have been updated

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: tests the value of CRYPTO_POLICY setting in the /etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensshserver.config file
Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present, with correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix.
Check control values of pam_unix, that it is followed by pam_faillock.so authfail and deny value of pam_faillock.so authfail
Check if pam_faillock.so is called in account phase before pam_unix
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth, has correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix
Check pam_faillock authfail is present after pam_unix, check pam_unix has proper control values, and authfail deny value is correct.
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase before pam_unix.
make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns3:variable_test.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd
<0, UID_MIN - 1> system UIDs having shell set
<0, SYS_UID_MIN> system UIDs having shell set
<SYS_UID_MIN, SYS_UID_MAX> system UIDS having shell set

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns3:variable_test.comment: The value of PASS_WARN_AGE should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_LEN should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns4:file_test.comment: Check if there aren't directories in root's path having write permission set for group or other

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: remote server to send audit records
Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host
Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host

ns4:file_test.comment: System log files are owned by root group
Permissions of system log files are correct
System log files are owned by root

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the presence of daily setting in /etc/logrotate.conf file
Tests the existence of /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file (and verify it actually calls logrotate utility)
Tests the value of the insecure locks in /etc/exports
Tests the value of the RhostsRSAAuthentication[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the absence of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab
Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf
Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf.d/*
tests the value of freq setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the value of local_events setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the absence of local_events setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the value of log_format setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the value of name_format setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the value of write_logs setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the absence of write_logs setting in the /etc/audit/auditd.conf file
tests the value of HostbasedAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the absence of HostbasedAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
